com.apriori.concurrent.scheduler

Interface ScheduledTaskDefinition<V>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - the type of value returned upon completion of the task
    All Superinterfaces:
    Cancellable, TaskDefinition<V>

    public interface ScheduledTaskDefinition<V>
extends TaskDefinition<V>, Cancellable
    A TaskDefinition that has been scheduled using a ScheduledTaskManager. This provides additional methods for introspection into the state of the scheduled tasks, including looking at past invocations of the task and canceling or pausing/resuming the scheduled tasks.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.apriori.concurrent.scheduler.TaskDefinition

    • Method Detail

      • submitTimeMillis

        long submitTimeMillis()
        Returns the timestamp, in milliseconds, that this task definition was submitted to a ScheduledTaskManager. This is measured as milliseconds elapsed since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC.
        Returns:
        the time the task definition was submitted

      • scheduledStartTimeMillis

        long scheduledStartTimeMillis()

      • executor

        ScheduledTaskManager executor()
        Returns the ScheduledTaskManager to which this task definition was submitted.
        Returns:
        the ScheduledTaskManager to which this task definition was submitted

      • executionCount

        int executionCount()
        Returns the total number of times that tasks have been executed for this task definition. This number includes both normal and abnormal completions. This only includes completed occurrences and does not include any currently scheduled or currently running occurrence.
        Returns:
        the count of executions

      • failureCount

        int failureCount()
        Returns the number of times that tasks have failed (completed abnormally) for this task definition.
        Returns:
        the count of failed executions

      • successCount

        int successCount()
        Returns the number of times that tasks have succeeded for this task definition.
        Returns:
        the count of successful executions

      • history

        List<ScheduledTask<V>> history()
        Returns the history of past executions for this task definition. Only a limited number of past executions are retained and returned in this collection. Iteration order of the returned collection is such that the most recent execution is returned first and the oldest retained execution is last.
        Returns:
        the history of past executions

      • latest

        ScheduledTask<V> latest()
        Returns details for the most recently completed invocation of this task definition. This is equivalent to: 
         scheduledTaskDefinition.history().get(0);
        Returns:
        details for the latest invocation

      • current

        ScheduledTask<V> current()
        Returns details for the currently scheduled invocation, which might be executing currently. This instance will not appear in the history until it has completed.

        This will be null if there is no invocation currently running or scheduled to run. This will be the case when the task definition is finished or cancelled. It can also occur when the task definition is paused.

        Returns:
        the currently scheduled invocation

      • addListener

        boolean addListener(ScheduledTaskListener<? super V> listener)
        Adds a listener that will be notified when task invocations complete.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener
        Returns:
        true if the listeners was added; false otherwise, such as if the listener was already added to this task definition

      • removeListener

        boolean removeListener(ScheduledTaskListener<? super V> listener)
        Removes a listener. No notifications will be sent to the listener after it is removed.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener
        Returns:
        true if the listener was removed; false otherwise, such as if the listener was never added to this task definition or has already been removed

      • isFinished

        boolean isFinished()
        Returns whether or not the task definition is finished. It is finished when all invocations are completed and the ScheduleNextTaskPolicy indicates that no next task need be scheduled. It is also considered finished if/when it is cancelled.
        Returns:
        true if the task definition is finished; false otherwise

      • cancel

        boolean cancel(boolean interrupt)
        Cancels this task definition. No more invocations will be scheduled. If so specified, any currently running invocation will be interrupted.

        Canceling a task definition that is already cancelled does nothing and will return false.

        Specified by:
        cancel in interface Cancellable
        Parameters:
        interrupt - true if a currently running invocation should be interrupted via Thread.interrupt()
        Returns:
        true if the task was cancelled; false if it could not be cancelled because it was already finished

      • isCancelled

        boolean isCancelled()
        Returns whether or not the task definition is cancelled. This will be the case if the task definition was cancelled before it finished normally.
        Returns:
        true if the task definition is cancelled; false otherwise

      • pause

        boolean pause()
        Pauses this task definition. If an invocation is currently running, it will be allowed to complete. After the currently running invocation completes, no further invocations will be scheduled until it is resumed.

        Pausing a task that is already paused does nothing and will return false.

        If a task definition needs to be paused with no invocation running, then the caller can check current() after pausing. If it is not null then a task is executing and the caller will need to block until it finishes.

        Returns:
        true if the task definition was paused; false if it could not be paused because it was already finished or paused
        See Also:
        resume()

      • isPaused

        boolean isPaused()
        Returns whether or not this task definition is currently paused.
        Returns:
        true if the task definition is paused; false otherwise

      • resume

        boolean resume()
        Resumes this task definition. If an invocation is still currently running then subsequent invocations will be scheduled normally upon its completion (as if the task definition were never paused). If no invocation is running, the next invocation is scheduled. If the task definition were paused for less than a repeating task's period/delay then subsequent invocations may be scheduled on time, with no delay introduced from the short time it was paused. If it were paused for more than the period/delay then the next invocation will be scheduled to start immediately. This may cause an invocation in the regular schedule of a fixed rate repeating task to be missed, just as if an invocation took too long to execute.

        Resuming a task definition that is not paused has no effect.

        Returns:
        true if the task definition was resumed; false if it could not be resumed because it was already finished or not paused
        See Also:
        pause()
